title: 'Female health worker' held hostage by inmate at UK's biggest jail
text:

A worker was held hostage at Britain's biggest 'super prison' just days after another inmate managed to climb onto its roof.

A member of staff at HMP Berwyn was rescued after being held hostage by an inmate yesterday morning in the second security incident at the jail in less than a week.

The Prison Service confirmed the incident at the Wrexham prison, which was resolved in less than a quarter of an hour.

A police investigation is now underway, reports North Wales Live .

(Image: Daily Post Wales)

(Image: Getty Images)

While the Prison Service did not comment on the identity of the worker, the staffer is said to have been a female health worker.

A police investigation is now underway but the Ministry of Justice said it will be "seeking the strongest possible punishment for the perpetrator".

The news comes three days after an inmate managed to climb onto the roof of the so-called "super-prison" causing a three-hour stand-off with officers before he was coaxed down.

Commenting on yesterday's incident a Prison Service spokeswoman said: "Staff at HMP Berwyn quickly resolved a one-on-one hostage situation this morning, without injury to the offender or the member of prison staff he had taken hostage.

(Image: Getty Images)

"The member of staff is being supported by the prison and we will be seeking the strongest possible punishment for the perpetrator."

The 2,100 inmate jail is the largest in the UK and opened in February 2017.

It is still not running at full capacity two-and-a-half years later.

The latest figures show it is around 60 per cent full.
description: The staffer had to be rescued after an inmate at HMP Berwyn in Wrexham took them hostage at 'super-prison'
